abstract.p: MVP.com, online sporting goods retailer founded by John Elway, Wayne Gretzky and Michael Jordan, and its agency, Leagas Delaney, have parted ways after nine months; spending for account was initially estimated at $50 million, but has recently been around $15 million (S)

block.p: MVP.com, the online sporting goods retailer founded by John Elway, Wayne Gretzky and Michael Jordan, and its agency, the San Francisco office of Leagas Delaney, have parted ways after nine months. Spending for the account was initially estimated at $50 million, but has recently been around $15 million.

Sean Ehringer, creative director at the agency, attributed the parting to ''some differences concerning the direction of the brand.'' Paula Davis, a spokeswoman at MVP.com in Chicago, described the parting as ''mutual'' and attributed it to ''creative differences.''

MVP.com, the online sporting goods retailer founded by John Elway, Wayne Gretzky and Michael Jordan, and its agency, the San Francisco office of Leagas Delaney, have parted ways after nine months. Spending for the account was initially estimated at $50 million, but has recently been around $15 million.

Sean Ehringer, creative director at the agency, attributed the parting to ''some differences concerning the direction of the brand.'' Paula Davis, a spokeswoman at MVP.com in Chicago, described the parting as ''mutual'' and attributed it to ''creative differences.''

The media planning and buying for the account will continue to be handled by Leagas Delaney, Ms. Davis said, adding that other services would be handled in-house and by agencies including Digital Edge in New York, part of the Media Edge unit of Young & Rubicam.
